tasks.task: Transitioning to regenerative farming practices and reducing chemical inputs.
subtasks: Shift focus from product-based approaches (herbicides, fungicides, fertilizers) to soil health and natural processes.
Reduce reliance on artificial nitrogen through system-based approaches and soil fertility improvement.
Plan long-term transition away from fossil-based agricultural inputs to more sustainable alternatives.

tasks.task: Implementing conservation agriculture and direct drilling methods.
subtasks: Adopting conservation agriculture practices to reduce machinery use and dependency on fossil fuels.
Utilizing direct drilling for cropping instead of conventional tillage methods to minimize fuel consumption and labor.
Increase mechanization efficiency by reducing tractor hours required for farming operations (from 800-1000 to 150-160 hours per year).
Improve weather resilience through reduced machinery dependency and varied on-farm activities.
Allocate time for additional work or contracting services outside traditional farming practices to balance workload.

tasks.task: Optimizing fuel efficiency and resource conservation.
subtasks: Reduce fuel consumption per hectare by optimizing operations (e.g., using stubble, efficient tillage, minimal inputs).
Compare current fuel usage (40-41 liters/ha) with historical usage (up to 160 liters/ha) to demonstrate significant potential for reduction.
Target fuel consumption reduction to a quarter of traditional levels as an extreme case scenario.
